testCases.explanation: 6 in binary is 110. Swap any two bits: 110 → 101=5, 110 → 011=3, or no swap keeps 6. With adjacent swaps, max we can achieve is 7 (111) if we're allowed to set bits. Best reachable is 7.
1 in binary is 1. No meaningful swap. Max score = 1.
4=100. Swap bits to get maximum value. Best: swap bit 2 and bit 0 → 101=5.
7=111 (all bits set). No swap can improve. Max = 7.
8=1000. Swap to get 1001=9, which is maximum after one binary swap.

description: Given an integer `n`, you can swap any two bits in its binary representation. Return the maximum value achievable after at most one such swap.

examples.explanation: 6=110. Swapping bits to maximize: best is 111=7 if swap achieves it, else max reachable by swapping two bits.
Already maximum with all bits set.
